isis.stitle: 7.3 Liter Diesel Engine Service (1991) - INJECTION PUMP, NOZZLES, FUEL FILTER, SUPPLY PUMP AND GLOW PLUGS - FUEL INJECTION NOZZLES - REASSEMBLY (NOZZLE COMPONENTS)

svcproc.title: REASSEMBLY (NOZZLE COMPONENTS)
svcproc.para:
After cleaning, inspecting, reconditioning and/or replacing the disassembled nozzle components, reassemble as follows: (Refer to Figure 9.54
.)

step1.para: Place nozzle holder in a vise standing in a vertical position.

note.para: Do not touch lapped surfaces. To avoid interchanging nozzle parts, reassemble one nozzle at a time.

step1.para: Dip all parts in clean calibrating fluid. Do not touch mating surfaces of components with fingers after dipping.
Install pressure adjusting shims, pressure adjusting spring and spring seat into nozzle holder body.

note.para: The thickest shim of the pack should contact the pressure adjusting spring.

step1.para: Install nozzle spacer on holder body assuring that locating dowels are positioned correctly.
With nozzle valve dipped in clean calibrating fluid, assemble valve into nozzle body and move valve up and down several times to assure the valve DOES NOT STICK.
Apply a thin, even coat of "Lubriplate - 630 AAA", or equivalent, to the nozzle body seating shoulder, align nozzle body locating pin holes with spacer pins and assemble nozzle to spacer.

note.para: Hold nozzle tightly against nozzle spacer while tightening.

step1.para: Secure assembly with nozzle cap nut turned hand-tight. Be sure nozzle tip is concentric with holder.
With nozzle clamped securely in a soft jawed vise, tighten nozzle cap nut using a 19/32 in. 12 pt. box wrench. Tighten to the specified torque using a torque wrench.
